origin: from Cotes de Provence, Provence, South of France, France
description: Rose petals, peaches, exotic fruits, pears, and apricots. On the palate, this wine is dry, fruity and mineral with a long finish. The grapes are from the best of the estate vineyards.

name: Josne Bourgete Gewurztrmas les Bernassofan Mountias Viailey Cles Ste. Mtogui Russe 2011
description: This Gewürztraminer is a bright yellow color. The nose is filled with notes of white flowers and exotic fruits. The mouthfeel is soft, with an aromatic freshness and minerality. The minerality is noticeable on the nose, with hints of white stone fruits and minerality. A harmonious balance between minerality and minerality.

name: Cebart Pincarion Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Fofeldle) 2016
origin: from Paso Robles, Central Coast, California
description: The 2016 Pincarion Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon is dark, deep purple in color with aromas of black cherry, cherry, and blackberry jam, with hints of mint and black pepper. The wine is balanced, full bodied, and full in the mouth with flavors of black cherry, cassis, and blueberry. The finish is long, with smooth tannins and balanced acidity. Pairs well with beef, grilled meats, and game, such as venison, rabbit, and duck.

name: Napa Cabernet Moite Cabernet Sauvignon 2005
description: The 2005 Moite Cabernet Sauvignon is a rich and concentrated wine. Flavors of black cherries, blackberries, plums and toasted oak are complemented by notes of black pepper, vanilla and a hint of oak. This full-bodied Cabernet is rich and concentrated with a rich, velvety texture and a long, long finish.

name: Marturitrow's Celerredter -  Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
description: The wine has a nose of cassis, dried cherries, and berry compote. On the palate the wine is lush and mouth filling, with flavors of ripe black cherries, cassis, plums, and a hint of spice. This balanced, smooth wine has a long, silky finish.

name: Lagy L'Acturec Rose 2018
origin: from Cotes de Provence, Provence, South of France, France
description: A brilliant salmon color, with an exotic nose of strawberries and melon. On the palate, this wine is crisp, with notes of melon, grapefruit and a hint of spice.

name: Koll-yold Nenache Vineyards Chardonnay 2018
description: The 2017 vintage is a richly-textured, full-bodied Chardonnay that is concentrated and powerful. A great balance of the aromas and flavors of the wine is the addition of a small amount of Riesling to the blend, and the addition of a small amount of Chenin Blanc and Gewurztraminer to the blend gives this wine an aromatic richness and a tropical flair. The wine is both lively and expressive, with the brightness and minerality from the Gewurztraminer showing through on the palate, and the more classic minerality from the Riesling showing in the wine.

name: Theep Celless Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
origin: from Paso Robles, Central Coast, California
description: Blend: 92% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Merlot, 2% Petit Verdot Theep Pinot Noir is a blend of three vineyards in the Paso Robles AVA. The cool climate of the AVA is ideal for growing classic Bordeaux varietals, such as Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. The Petit Verdot contributes to the wine’s deep purple hue, while the Merlot adds a soft, fleshy texture. The wine’s robust tannins, balanced acidity and rich fruit make it an ideal match for grilled salmon, roast duck, and beef.

name: Staty Mongleser Sererold Cabernet Sauvignon 2011
origin: from Diamond Mountain District, Napa Valley, California
description: The 2011 vintage of our Syrah-based Cabernet Sauvignon is a focused, pure expression of the unique clone. The deep purple hue of this full-bodied Cabernet heralds a compelling nose of cassis, blackberry and black currant fruit that’s interwoven with subtle notes of sandalwood, spice and a hint of smoke. The palate is rich and opulent with flavors of boysenberry, blackberry and crème de cassis. A lively acidity and refined tannins frame the fruit and provide a balanced, polished wine with an elegant finish. Enjoy this Cabernet Sauvignon now and over the next 10-15 years.

name: Willaset Tolfer Grea GSde Browlell Pinot Noir 2004
description: The wine's deep, opaque color and vibrant, deep nose herald a very elegant, rich and focused wine. Flavors of ripe dark fruit and dark berries, with layers of refined French oak, are interwoven with a core of fruit and balanced acidity. A long, smooth, silky finish heralds the wine's aging potential.

name: Bedegas Hanner Rapos Sp. Lavper Merbot 2015
description: Deep, intense and cherry-red with shades of purple. Very aromatic, combining the freshness and the roundness of the Tempranillo variety, with notes of mint, black pepper and vanilla. The tannic structure is balanced, with a lively, mineral acidity, giving the wine a long and persistent finish.

name: Brot Napi Mothate Chardonnay 2015
description: The Napa Valley Chardonnay is often characterized by the high quality of the fruit and terroir, but this region is an area of the world that has no such quality. This Chardonnay is from the warmer, northern end of the Napa Valley, where the grapes ripen evenly, developing tropical fruit flavors and crisp acidity.

name: Fobastice Barols Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
description: The 2016 vintage is a rich, full-bodied wine that shows deep garnet color, a complex nose of spice and berries and a well-balanced palate with velvety tannins. The wine shows an elegance and finesse with a long finish. The 2016 vintage is a very well balanced wine with a long finish. It is ready to drink now and has a great ageing potential.

name: Fatonces Thegal Zalli 2002
description: Bouquet: Intense, full-bodied with spices and berry fruit. Palate: Full, warm, soft but solid with balanced tannins.  Serving Suggestions: Excellent with red meats or grilled vegetables.  Serving Temperature: 18°C/60°F

name: Tirradolo Velpamal 2018
description: Blend: 50% Sangiovese, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc The 2018 vintage of this wine is a real mouthful. On the nose, it shows intense aromas of spice and dark berry fruit. It is full-bodied with velvety tannins and beautiful concentration and a long finish. It is an amazing wine to drink now, but has the potential to age well.

name: Pricken Estate Chardonnay 1999
description: This wine was bottled unfined and unfiltered. The nose of this wine is filled with caramel and spice. The mouthfeel is soft and full of creamy oak. The palate has a wonderful core of ripe fruit and is rich in texture. The wine has a long and spicy finish.  This is the perfect wine to serve with grilled salmon or halibut. Try this with any white wine pasta dish.

name: Xches-Doekape Riesling Reserva Merlot 1994
description: This is the wine of choice to pair with spicy Asian-Fusion cuisine. It will also pair well with any soft, spicy Asian-Fusion cuisine.  .  and intense ripe fruit, plump, full-bodied, and silky tannins, with a long finish. This wine is a blend of 50% Syrah, 40% Grenache, 10% Cinsault and 10% Mourvedre.  It is a brilliant light-gold wine with a deep purple rim.  The aroma is full of concentrated plummy fruit with subtle spicy oak undertones.  It has a warm, spicy, smooth palate with an intense fruit and spice aftertaste.  It has a deep, rich mouth feel, and a long, soft finish.

name: Wilfa Merlot 2003
description: The wine is medium garnet in color. On the nose the wine shows aromas of cherries and plums, and on the palate the wine is rich and elegant, with cherry/currant fruit, and a slight herbal/herbal edge. A well balanced wine with a lingering finish.

name: Levia Lesapa Nez-& Macidon Leapellet Rorgeneulle 2015
description: Slightly sweet and spicy with high-toned stone fruit and white peach fruit, this wine is dry, warm and almost creamy in texture. It is long on the palate with a minerally dry finish.

name: Chateau Sol Fumeil Les-Comtantier Cote Las 1994
description: A brilliant pale-straw color with green reflections. The nose is open and refined, showing intense aromas of lime peel, citrus fruit, fennel and ripe fruit salad. In the mouth the wine is silky, well-balanced and very harmonious with a very long finish. This is a powerful wine with an attractive aromatic range of citrus fruit, herbs and mineral notes. The wine is pleasant, fresh and tasty now, but has the potential to age for a few years.

name: Jabosel-Pered Beaujales 2016
description: It’s a beautiful garnet color, with violet reflections. It’s elegant on the nose, with aromas of black fruits, spices and vanilla. On the palate, it is harmonious and balanced, with soft tannins and beautiful structure. It’s a pleasure to drink now, but will develop even greater complexity in next years.

name: Tnovia Grye Old Landria Sauvignon Blanc 2014

description: Pale straw with a green hue. Aromas of white peach, tangerine and white flowers, with a hint of grass. The palate is creamy and rich, with flavors of lemon curd, fresh fig, grapefruit, honeydew and pineapple.

name: Bosoa Grenona Cellarba Syrah 2011
description: A blend of mostly Garnacha, with Syrah and Tempranillo, aged in new French and American oak. Pairs well with grilled meats, spicy Mediterranean cuisine, and dry Mediterranean fare., then another big wine from the region. Intense dark cherry/purple color. Rich and concentrated with a deep perfume of ripe blackberries, plums, and sweet spices. A full-bodied wine with a rich, chewy core of dark fruit. It has a thick texture with a rich concentration of fruit and a long, concentrated finish. It is a great example of why Spain is a great partner for this new area of the world. It is a perfect example of why Spain is producing the best wines from this region.

name: Lampaista Sharpalino Brannos Vina Cabernet Sauvignon (375ML halff-bottourt Rand Moise 1997
description: The 1997 Sharpalino Vigna Cabernet Sauvignon is a rich ruby color. On the nose, ripe cherries, spice and cedar aromas mingle with the unique characteristics of the varietal and terroir. The flavors of cherries, spice and cedar are wrapped in a soft, supple texture, with a long, full finish. The color of the wine is deep, with shades of garnet and good depth. The bouquet is full and round, with the ideal balance of fruit, oak, tannin, acid and structure. The wine shows well now, but will continue to improve in the bottle. In keeping with the philosophy that the natural process will take place, this wine is produced from the best fruit from the best vineyards in our vineyards to be released as is the best, most enjoyable wine from the best of the best of the vintage.

The palate is full and intense with wonderful fruit richness and soft tannins. A long, pure and complex finish with the finesse that is the hallmark of great Australian shiraz.

name: HogeLod Eostate Rege Chardonnay 1999
origin: from Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon
description: .  The grapes are hand-harvested and sorted, lightly pressed and placed in vertical fermentors.  The juice is then matured for five months in French oak barrels.  After malolactic fermentation the wine is racked into barrels for maturation.  The wine is bottled after six months barrel aging, a third barrel from new oak and one year old oak barrels.  The wine shows bright tropical fruit with citrus and floral aromas.  Its rich and smooth on the palate with a long finish.  A great wine to enjoy with grilled fish, seafood, poultry or pasta.

This Chardonnay is a great match with richly-flavored fish such as halibut topped with fruit salsa or a classic shrimp cocktail with a side of pico de gallo.

name: Joseph Stouling Russiann-Shiller Vineyard Promier Cru 1996
description: , [category_1] St. Innocent Zenith the word perfume comes to mind, and it is often used to describe the wines of eastern Sicily. We know that the wine has a punchy fruitiness, but that isotto with lots of flavor and substance, a very fine balance between fruit, tannin, alcohol, and the French oak. In fact, the French winemaking style is more of a California style, where the fruit is predominant and the wine is round, soft and elegant.

name: Rotchlezonno Calery R Roos SOtere Sivigny Zinfandel (375ML half-bottle) 2002
description: , but it's really quite an amazing press wine as well as an amazing value. A blend of 65-year old head-trained Cabernet Sauvignon, 30-year old Cabernet Franc, and 5-year old Petit Verdot, the 2002 vintage exhibits a deep ruby/purple color as well as a perfume of smoke, spice box, and cedar. This is a full-bodied, layered, rich wine with loads of fruit, great fruit, and a long, long finish. It should be drunk over the next 2-3 years.-Wine Advocate

name: Flantellino Estate Pinot Noir 1999
description: Bouquet: clean and pleasant, discreetly fruity with clean scents of violets.  Flavors: dry, harmonious and velvety.  Serving Suggestions: cold meats, hearty fish dishes, risotto and pasta.  Serving Temperature: 16°C. Cellaring: 3 years.

name: Morcecz Sauvignon Blanc 2016
description: The 2016 Sauvignon Blanc is a beautiful light straw color. Aromas of melon, apricot and lemon-lime are complemented by a subtle hint of minerality. A vibrant palate of melon, nectarine and lemon-lime is balanced by a pleasant acidity. With a bright and clean finish, this Sauvignon Blanc will pair well with any seafood dish or on its own.

name: PEChandous Zinfandel (1.5 Litel 1985 Pethi Famillelliss Blac SSviet Blanc 1999
description: Pale gold in color, ripe tropical fruit aromas of pineapple and pineapple are complimented with subtle floral tones of orange blossom, gardenia, and chamomile. Medium bodied, the wine has a pleasing roundness in the mouth, and is nicely balanced with a refreshing acidity. The finish is long and clean, with a lingering impression of ripe tropical fruit and lemon zest.

name: P. haP Montel & Bonches Vineyard Shiraz 2013
origin: from McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
description: Blend: 98% Shiraz, 2% Viognier , one of the best values in the world of wine. One of the best values in the market place. A deep garnet red color with a rich and complex bouquet of black cherry, plums and a hint of spice. On the palate the wine is full bodied with a nose of blackberries, mint and a touch of toasty oak.  The tannins are soft and round with a smooth, lingering finish.

name: Carmisu Sansangere Sauvignon Blanc 2003
description: A very good companion to seafood, pasta, risotto, poultry, fish and rice dishes.  It is an ideal accompaniment to any dish that marries well with cream sauces, or has a fresh fruit such as a citrus or a fresh goat cheese.  It also complements a variety of vegetables such as as asparagus, peasirées, seafood, risotto, seafood, risotto, paella, poultry, duck, and even pâté.

name: Kibasson Zinfandel 2002
description: The color of the wine is dark purple, dense and deep. The nose is full of blackberries, currants and spice. Intense, full-bodied and rich, with abundant black fruit and a long finish, this wine is a must with grilled steak, barbecued ribs, and spicy Italian dishes.

name: Robantettiano Cabernat Sauvignon 2015
description: This wine is perfect with first courses of red meats and game. Its great structure will also make it an ideal partner for a vegetarian dish. Robert Mondavi Napa Cabernet Sauvignon 2011 [response] [category_1] Red Wine [category_2] Cabernet Sauvignon

name: Binkramg Willenge Merlot Black Tinrembers 2014
description: Blend: 82% Merlot, 11% Syrah, 4% Malbec The Merlot vines are grown on decomposed granite soils and harvested early in the season. The resulting wine is full bodied and rich with intense berry fruit, exotic spice and a touch of chocolate. This Merlot is a good example of the Cape's unique terroir.

name: Muistoellan Chabine dever Couxes Les Dosone Rose 2016
origin: from Cachapoal Valley, Rapel Valley, Chile
description: This Chablis rosé is an excellent companion for any summery occasion. Its bright, clear, and lively citrus and berry-like aromas and flavors make it a great accompaniment to grilled fish, shrimp, and white meats.

name: Bracheth Y Solon Cuevalle Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
origin: from Santa Ynez Valley, Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California
description: Deep dark ruby in color. Lush aromas of black cherry, licorice, and white pepper. An elegant palate of dark berries, spice, and sweet vanilla. Soft, velvety tannins lead to a long finish.

name: Tonoffier PeNe Zanlen L'Ange 1120 2010
description: The wine is made from fruit from Pinot Noir (85%) and Syrah (5%) grown on clay-limestone slopes.  This dry, full-bodied red wine is deep ruby in color, dense and ripe with a dark fruit nose, a rich mouthfeel and soft tannins.

name: Patfard Chardonnay 2016
description: The 2016 Sonoma County Chardonnay has a pale straw color with glimmering reflections. Aromas of white flowers, lemon peel, and green apple are complimented by tropical fruit notes of pineapple and citrus. The palate is soft and full, with notes of fresh nectarine and a hint of honey. This wine has a balanced acidity and is well-balanced with a touch of toasty oak, leading to a long finish with fresh and mineral flavors.

name: Mourtan Treves Vouve1da 2011
description: Deep garnet red color. The nose is rich, with notes of black fruit, spice and herbs. On the palate it is full-bodied, soft and velvety, with flavors of blackberry, spice and herbs.

name: Domaine Cartignon Howeir Lea Cotes du (Bat-Ytae Vaures 2015
origin: from Languedoc, South of France, France
description: Blend: 55% Syrah, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Grenache, 10% Mourvèdre

name: Domaine des Besriestles Tire Vallay Red 1909
origin: from Languedoc, South of France, France
description: Blend: 60% Syrah, 20% Grenache, 10% Carignan, 10% Mourvedre, 10% Cinsault, [category_1] A delicious wine with a deep purple color.  It has an intense aroma of plums, cherries, spice and cassis.  On the palate, it is smooth, round and supple with flavors of plums, cherries and red fruits.  It is a versatile wine, excellent as an aperitif, excellent with food, fun and versatile enough to pair with a wide range of foods.

name: Gorden Corpannino Biana Barbo 2009
description: Pairs well with grilled meats, cured meats, poultry, pasta, pizza, rice and vegetables. ,our winemaking philosophy is simple: less intervention is better in order to preserve the character of the fruit. After a long cold soak, the grapes are destemmed, pressed and fermented in stainless steel tanks. The wine is aged in French oak barrels for 18 months.

name: Falosto Granisoal Rose Familaa Sauvignon Blanc 2005
description: This wine has a light, bright, pale color. The nose is fresh and floral, with hints of lime and grapefruit. The entry on the palate is soft, but with a refreshing acidity that builds through the finish. It is light on the mouthfeel, with flavors of citrus and minerality. It is a refreshing wine with food.

name: Porgiadoacho 511 Diealo 1999
description: Intense ruby red in color. Harmonious and complex, with dried fruit and spice. On the palate it is well structured, with excellent tannic structure, well balanced, with an extraordinary finish. name: La Tobetrosk Chardonnay 2008
description: Inviting tropical fruit aromas lead to layers of lemon, apple and mineral notes on the palate, with a finish of crisp, clean acidity., origin, and appellation is what sets this bottling apart from most of the rest of our Chardonnays. The final blend for this wine is a brilliant straw-colored Chardonnay with a delicate nose of crisp apples and pears. It has good structure and balance with fresh acidity and a clean, fruity finish.

name: MaFgioni Torso Rirgsano 2017
description: Intense ruby red color. The nose is fruity and complex, with notes of plums, cherries and sweet spices. The palate is soft and rounded, with flavors of raspberries, cherries, spices and vanilla. The finish is long and persistent.

name: Domaine Paraile Cove Roose 2001
origin: from Languedoc, South of France, France
description: Blend: 70% Syrah, 20% Grenache, 10% Carignan The family of three from the village ofRoederer in the Côtes de Francs appellation of the Languedoc region of the Languedoc region in the Languedoc region of France has a unique and unique taste of the Languedoc region.

name: Wolla Marsith Chiant Classico Chardonnay (OK Kosher) 2014
origin: from Chiant Classico, Chianti, Tuscany, Italy
description: This wine is delicious with grilled poultry, pasta with shellfish and seasoned fish dishes.  Wine Spots Napa Valley Chardonnay 2015 [response] [category_1] White Wine Spots Chardonnay [origin]  from Napa Valley, Tuscany, Italy

name: Kon Pa Surali Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc 2001
description: Foppiano's Estate Sauvignon Blanc comes from four different vineyards. They are all estate grown. The cool climate of the Russian River Valley, and particularly good growing conditions, allowed the grapes at lower sugars and higher acidity. This allowed the grapes to become a full-bodied, rich wine. After harvest, the fruit was hand-sorted and gently pressed. The juice was then cold settled and cold-stirredly chilled to preserve the crisp, fruity quality and aromatic qualities of the wine. After cold settling, the juice was barrel fermented in French oak barrels to add complexity and balance. The wine was bottled after two months of barrel aging.

name: Folanabino Tillza's Gauvahi Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2001
description: This wine's label is a drawing of a black-necked ribeye with a star anise, mint, and eucalyptus. The nose is followed by a black-currant, cherry, and blackberry bouquet. On the palate, the wine is medium bodied, with soft tannins and a long finish. The wine's label can be seen in the months following release.

name: Seltiata Hancia Wines Abage 2013
description: Intense ruby red color. On the nose, notes of red fruit and spices. On the palate, this wine is balanced and round with aromas of plums, cherries, and spices. The finish is long and harmonious.

name: Balminato Barolo Pinot Grigio Blancco 2018
description: Pale yellow in color. An elegant nose of white flowers, fresh fruit and spices. A rich, velvety, long-lasting wine, with a balanced acidity, refreshing fruit, and mineral notes.

name: Brunymoh Ognemle 2013
description: Pairs well with grilled meats and cheeses, such as Parmigiano Reggiano or aged Gouda cheese. , the first in the mouth a caress of red fruit, such as cherry or strawberry. The mid-palate is soft and silky. The tannins are soft and pleasant. The wine is well balanced and the finish is long and fruity.

name: Jodslon Peth Nesastle Vingers Zinfandel 2004
description: The 2004 Petite Sirah (100% estate) has a dark purple color as well as aromas of creosote, blackberries, and a hint of pepper. On the palate it is medium-bodied, with loads of fruit and spice. The tannins are soft and supple, and the wine has excellent balance. The finish is long and spicy. It should be enjoyed over the next 2-3 years. - Wine Advocate

name: Hour Gawnerr Cabernet Frion 2010
description: Blend: 52% Merlot, 26% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Syrah, 7% Malbec . The wine is deeply purple-colored, almost black. The nose is broad and open, with notes of plum, black cherry, spice and toasty oak. On the palate, the wine is bold, concentrated and quite lush. The tannins are soft and round. The finish is long and lingering. This wine is a blend of the best from our three estates. It is a balanced wine, with good fruit and structure. The wine has good structure and should be drunk well now, but can be aged for a few years. It will pair well with grilled meats and wild game.

name: Jos' Stamet Sananzonni Cabetere Merlac 2016
description: It is a great match with roasted meats, game, braises and mature cheeses.. Deep garnet red with purple reflections. Vivid purple-black in color, this wine shows an intense bouquet of black cherry, wild berries and violets. The palate is dry, full-bodied and well balanced with velvety tannins. It has a lingering finish with a hint of almonds.

name: Siello Seres Prote Red Blend 2016
description: Deep ruby color. On the nose, the wine shows fresh red fruit aromas with floral notes and spices. The palate is well balanced, with nice acidity, fine tannins and a fresh, long finish.

name: Neyot Focker Estate Shiraz 1998
description: The grapes were harvested in the final week of February 1998, and the wine was aged in French and American oak hogsheads for 16 months. The wine shows a deep dark colour with a spicy bouquet. The wine is soft and full bodied, with a fine tannin backbone, with a well balanced fruit level. The palate is long and complex, with a hint of pepper. The wine has a sweet mid palate with a savoury dry finish. The wine will develop further complexity with 3 - 5 years cellaring.

name: Tartariebolt Brink Tolberts 2002
description: Bright gold in color, with a delicate, effusive nose of ripe peach, apricots, nutmeg and pineapple.  A creamy, velvety palate of rich fruit and nutmeg with a hint of toast.  The finish is long and complex with a fine fruit acid level.

name: Anen Duills Chardete di Cabernet Sauvignon (3 Liter Black Suvatti Pinat Noir 2017
description: AnenDuills’ Chardet is a rich, elegant, concentrated wine with a deep ruby color and excellent structure. The bouquet is of dark cherries, spice and anise. The palate is soft and round with fine tannins and excellent length. A rich, concentrated wine of great aging potential.

name: Chateau Jomre Ferlenze Eniter Ord Zinffines 2016
origin: from Cotes de Francs, Rhone, France
description: Deep garnet red in color, this wine has a great finesse with a nose of violets and cherries and a mineral edge. It is very expressive on the palate with a lot of fruit, but with a great balance and elegance. It is an elegant wine with a great finesse.

name: Brunidger Edests'n Stpolebleronde Grener Sauvignon Blanc 2016
description: Edsels, pungent, refreshing, aromatic, dry and crisp, with zesty acidity framing a juicy core of mineral-tinged apple and pear flavors, and a touch of minerality on the finish. The mouthfeel is long, with a touch of sweetness and richness. It is ready to drink now, and should continue to evolve in bottle.

name: Pieldsbards Wallesh-Genarger Riesling Pinot Gris 2012
description: The grapes for this wine come from the slopes of the Rhône Valley and the hills of Provence. The vines are on average, 30 to 40 year old vines. The wine is fermented and aged in stainless steel tanks. The wine is characterized by a very pale color, with an aroma of honey and a taste of melon and citrus fruit, which is balanced with a hint of minerality and a long finish. It will be a pleasant accompaniment to poultry and white meats.

name: Boy Barrer Sonova Sauvignon Blan Selecte Pascian Rise 2014
description: The wine is pure and complex, with aromas of citrus peel, nectarine, honeydew and lemon curd. On the palate, a creamy richness is framed by a mineral edge, and is nicely balanced with crisp acidity and a lingering finish. The wine can be enjoyed by itself as an aperitif, but is also delicious with spicy Asian and Thai cuisine.

name: Mallibarico 4Piana Q Sauvignon Grig Celliauita 2016
description: Excellent with all kinds of starters, soups, fish and seafood, this wine also goes well with pastas, risottos, poultry, pork, and even some spicy dishes.

name: Folia Fourna Barolone 2015
description: The color of this wine is deep ruby. It has a nose of wild berries, blackberry and pomegranate, with hints of vanilla. On the palate, it is dry, medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a pleasant finish. It is the perfect match for roasted meats, stews and casseroles. It also pairs well with mature cheeses.

name: Arnodis Semilion Uvanetle's MeaCEtor Cabernet Soigano 2018
description: Pairs well with cold cuts, tuna, and salmon. A blend of 50% Tempranillo, 20% Garnacha, 20% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Syrah, 10% Grenache, 10% Cabernet Franc and 10% Petit Verdot, the wine shows a deep purple color, with a rich nose of cassis, black cherries, and spice. On the palate, it is complex, with excellent body, good structure, and great balance. It is an elegant wine with a silky, long finish. It pairs well with grilled meats, pasta, pizza, pizza, and risotto.

name: Luurse Marnot Aux 2007
description: This wine has a deep purple color. The nose is of sweet spices, especially cloves and nutmeg, with a hint of licorice. The palate is full, with great structure, with a rich, warm texture, and lots of black fruit. This wine has a good tannic structure, but a round, soft attack gives way to a long and balanced finish. It is an exceptional wine. It can be aged for 10 years.

name: Gayter Jack Peales Stata 2016
description: Blend: 52% Syrah, 16% Grenache, 14% Petite Sirah, 9% Mourvèdre, 5% Viognier A deep purple color with a nose of cherries, black plums, dried cherries, and pomegranate. On the palate, the fruit is abundant, with a touch of plums, strawberries, and raspberries.  A full-bodied wine with a long finish with a lingering and balanced tannins.

name: Sten Nicketa Reserve Pinot Gris 2005
description: The 2005 Pinot Gris is rich and full-bodied. The nose exhibits aromas of citrus, stone fruits, and pear. On the palate the wine is soft and elegant with a rich mid-palate and great balance. Flavors of stone fruits, grapefruit and citrus are complemented by subtle spicy oak characters. The wine is long and persistent, with a mineral texture and long, fine-grained tannins on the finish.

name: Truck Wine D Vatarking la Cabernet Marlon 2011
description: The 2011 vintage is a perfect match with grilled lamb chops or a juicy, hard-rind burger with all the trimmings.  It's the first time in the estate winery to see if the Petit Verdot will be the real charm and rock that is found in the winery. With the Petit Vdot and the 2011 vintage, the wines are a little closed, but still bright and open.  The wine has a deep garnet-red hue and beautiful aromas of black cherry and spice.  On the palate the wine is harmonious, with a richly balanced and smooth texture and a lingering finish.  This is a wine to drink well on release, but would benefit from decanting.

name: Losa Cotesu Rosta Bruchraoso 2017
description: Deep garnet red. On the nose, intense aromas of blackberry, blueberry, and cassis, with notes of chocolate and licorice. It is full-bodied and harmonious on the palate, with soft tannins and a pleasant, long finish.

name: BInWica Red Balbarzsnucro Colnami Roastana (375ML half-bottle) 2007
description: Bright cherry-red in color. On the nose, aromas of fresh strawberries, plums and a hint of toasty oak. On the palate, ripe red fruit and balanced acidity lead to a soft, rounded finish.

name: Liaune Lanomatoli Pernondany Vy Courte AuKlote Riesling 2007
description: This Riesling is made in a riper, more off-dry style than the vineyard designated vintages.  It is harvested early in the season and has a fresh, minerally nose. It has a lovely, ripe, almost juicy, ripe palate of late-summer fruit, with a savory edge to the finish. It has a bright, juicy acidity and an elegant, fine finish.

name: De Forens Ganton Barinas Comion Ca abigna Bunzadese 2009
description: Blend: 50% Monastrell, 40% Garnacha, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon Domaine Du Castel Ring, owner of Labastida Winery in the village of Castel Ring, is a top-notch producer of this wine from a selection of the best old-vine fruit in the region. The G Stanton family is involved in the production of their Cueca wines, the oldest known example of the Monastrell grape in Spain, and the oldest known example of the grape in the world. They have been making wine in the region since 1787. This Cueca is a blend of four varietals, made from a selection of their best lots. The Garnacha (70-100 year-old) wines, with the oldest vines in the area.

name: Girerie Cellary C51 Stwine Serrore 2012
description: The 2012 vintage of this Syrah-based wine is rich and balanced. On the nose, the wine shows aromas of fresh berries and pomegranate with subtle hints of cigar box and a hint of cedar. On the palate, this wine shows a deep color, high-quality tannins and a full body with layers of flavors. A savory finish of lavender and smoked meats is followed by a hint of cocoa powder.

name: Anbackilits Chardonnay 1999
description: The fruit was sourced from three cool climate viticultural regions - the Yarra Valley, Heathcote and Bendigo. Each region has added an interesting character to the final blend for this Chardonnay. The Yarra Valley is always a cool climate with a high mineral concentration, Heathcote is a warmer climate with high fruit concentration and thepinees a softer, stony character. The Petit Verdot component adds a soft, floral character. The French oak component has given the wine a subtle complexity. The result is a wine with rich fruit, great palate structure and a smooth soft finish.

name: Steado Terrare Vineyard Chardonnay 2009
description: This wine is very pale in color. It has a very long, fruity and clean nose, with hints of butterscotch and toast. On the palate it is well-balanced, with great acidity and good structure. It has a long finish.

name: Gurrenton Rose Erd Dhinuttive Windem Riesling 2017
description: Light yellow color with a light greenish glint. Very fresh and intense nose with a hint of citrus fruits, peach, apricot, lychee, honey and minerals. Fresh and balanced on the palate, with lots of fruit and a hint of minerality. The mineral notes and acidity give a long and pleasant finish.

name: Spoffenter Coast Stage Hord Pinot Noir 2015
description: The grapes for this wine come from our vineyards in the northern end of the Sonoma Coast AVA. This region is bordered by the Russian River Valley and Coastal Range, which leads to the Petaluma Gap in western Sonoma County. The rolling hills of this region have an east-southeast exposure, with a coastal ridge in between. The cool winds temper the influence of the Van Duzer Corridor and the Pacific Ocean in the morning. This climate, combined with the cool breezes from the nearby Russian River Valley, produce Pinot Noir grapes with exceptional varietal character, depth, and structure.

name: Edrepallo Resters Refiche 2013
description: Pair with beef and pork, or even meat-based pasta sauces. An excellent match for hard cheeses. Domaine EdREPasso & Fils Savigny-les-Beaune Les Côtes Rôtes de la Vougeot 2012 [response] [category_1] Red Wine [category_2] Pinot Noir [category_2] Pinot Noir [origin]  from Savigny-les-Beaune, Côtes de Beaune, Côtes d'Or, Burgundy, France

name: Froewyon Cabernet Sauvignon Tero Alora Bernonze 2002
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah grapes from 35 year old vines, with a small addition of Malbec from the Garnacha estate.  The wine was aged in French and American oak barrels for 18 months before being bottled unfined and unfiltered.  It is a complex wine with good structure and great depth of fruit.  This wine shows the elegance and class of the best Spanish wines.

name: Bodisaszy Fodrers  ba 1997
description: Fodrer is a blend of Merlot (50%), Syrah (20%) and Tempranillo (20%) aged in French oak barrels for 16 months.  This blend of native varieties, is an impressive introduction to the Pesquera family.  The French winemaking method, in which the wines are aged separately, is the foundation of the Pesquera wine.

name: BraVidola Spion Daro Anca Gionto 2013
description: Intense ruby red color. On the nose, the bouquet is fruity with scents of wild berries, cherry and plum. The flavor is dry, harmonious, and full of character with a fruity aftertaste. This wine pairs well with red meat, roasts, noble game, and medium aged cheese.

name: Louis D'Cou Mantily Sauvignon Blanc 2005
description: The wine is full-bodied with a lovely aromas of citrus and pineapple. The mouth is soft and smooth, with a well balanced acidity that is complemented by a lingering finish. It is a wonderful companion to seafood, poultry and light pasta dishes.

name: Andeszol Vinfandel 2012
description: The wine is deep, almost black, with purple hues. It has a great aromatic intensity, with notes of red fruit, balsamic and spices. On the palate it is balanced and with great structure. It has a great balance between fruit and oak, and has a long finish.

name: Durmonde Riesling 19 COssaroad Montabiei Vigna Pinot Grigio 2011
description: This wine is a brilliant light straw color. On the nose, it is fresh, with scents of peach, apricot and honeysuckle. The palate is fresh, with flavors of peach, apricot and honey. It is balanced with a dry finish.

name: Iima Serotow Chardonnay 2005
origin: from Russian River, Sonoma County, California
description: The 2005 Iima Serot is a rich, rich, smooth wine. A medium bodied Chardonnay, with aromas of ripe apples and tropical fruits. The palate is filled with layers of fresh citrus, apple and vanilla. This wine is very fruit forward and balanced with a long smooth finish.

name: Verts Sainta Sauvignon Blanc 2009
description: The 2009 Verts is sourced from four estate vineyards. The grapes are hand-harvested, hand-sorted and gently pressed. The wine is then barrel fermented and the lees are stirred weekly. It has a brilliant pale straw color with green hues. The nose is fresh, vibrant and very aromatic with lime and passionfruit. The palate is a lively, pure, elegant wine showing intense passionfruit, passionfruit and white peach characters, with a long mineral finish.

name: Castilo & Vins Conek Chardonnay 2009
description: Conek is a fresh, crisp and fruity wine made from the indigenous Spanish varietal, Chardonnay, with a small addition of Riesling. A fresh and fruity wine with a lovely balance between acidity and fruit. It has a pale yellow color with greenish hues. It has a fruity nose with notes of apple, citrus and herbs. It has a fresh and fruity mouthfeel with mineral notes and a nice finish.

name: Kenghois Pinot Noir Santas Aumignon (1.5 Liter Magnum) 2012
description: Kenghois' Pinot Noir Santas Aumignon is bright garnet in color with aromas of red cherry, plum and raspberry. The palate is fresh and vibrant with bright acidity and fine tannins. Its bright fruit flavors and its light acidity make it an ideal accompaniment to a wide range of foods, including pasta, pizza, poultry, barbecue and even spicy Asian dishes.

name: Araito Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
description: The 2014 Araito Cabernet Sauvignon is a deep, dark, purple color. On the nose, the wine shows notes of dark cherries and dark plums, with hints of tobacco, spice, and cedar. On the palate, the wine is full-bodied, with layers of ripe, black cherry, and dark chocolate flavors, with a touch of spice and cedar. Firm tannins and balanced acidity lend structure and a long, smooth finish. This is a smooth, well-structured Cabernet Sauvignon with a good aging potential. Enjoy this wine with grilled red meats, braises or stews, and pasta with meat sauce or game sauce.

name: Tyrrano Rid 2014
description: Ideal to accompany pasta, roasted meat and cheese. Pairs well with beef, pork, venison and cheeses.  and then there is the big challenge of getting to taste the wine. It's hard to imagine a wine that is so good without being too harsh. That is why we try to make this wine. It's also interesting to try a bottle with a slightly different label. It is hard to imagine a wine without an alcohol level. This wine has a deep purple color. On the nose, the wine shows aromas of berries and spices, with some earthy notes. It has a complex structure with smooth tannins and a good concentration in the mouth. It has a good tannic structure with a good acid level, and the wine is still young. This wine has a good aging potential, but we have no final fruit to enjoy it right now.

name: Blatimis Pinot Grigio 1997
description: The 1997 Pinot Grigio grape can be drunk as an aperitif and is a wonderful accompaniment to pasta dishes, fish, poultry and light pasta dishes. It is excellent with Asian dishes and sushi.

name: Santasbai halferelo Noray Granden Chardonnay (1.5 L)ter Magchum 2004
description: The mouthwatering, full-bodied palate of this wine is long and persistent with ripe apple and pear flavors and a lush texture. Great with seafood and pasta with shellfish sauces.

name: Chanley Wine Familyen Unexen. Ancedustin Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
description: . Full-bodied and rich, this wine has a garnet core with aromas of blueberry, black cherry, and ripe plum. Subtle notes of sweet toasty oak and chocolate add dimension to the wine's aromas. Full-bodied and silky in texture with layers of ripe, rich flavors, the wine's refined tannins add structure to the wine, which carries through to a long, balanced finish.

name: Itheyari Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2012
origin: from Howell Mountain, Napa Valley, California
description: Blend: 77% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Merlot, 9% Petit Verdot, 7% Malbec The Estate Cabernet Sauvignon vineyard is located on Howell Mountain at the winery and is the first estate winery to have been associated with the Napa Valley. The Cabernet grapes are hand-harvested at night and sorted before going through a gravity flow system. The wine is aged for 16 months in French oak barrels.

name: Mosin Hirs Wine Chegtanicure Chardonnay 2015
description: The Hirs “Vintage” Chardonnay is made from grapes grown in the region of Napa. The soil is volcanic and clay, which leads to a very cool climate. The majority of the blend is barrel fermented, which is a nice surprise as this soil and climate in the Napa Valley have no effect on the wines quality. We harvest at night to retain the bright fruit and acidity in the wine. This Hirs wine has beautiful aromas of fresh lemon peel and tropical fruits, along with hints of jasmine, sandalwood, fresh cut grass and dried herbs. The palate is lush with flavors of lemon, orange rind, honeysuckle and toasted bread.

name: Bargadpe Croffi Surai Napa La Vierco 2011
description: This wine is a blend of Malbec and Syrah grapes from the Piedmont region of Napa. The result is a wine with great structure and complexity. The nose is rich and fruity with hints of red fruits, plums, berry jam, and spices. The mouthfeel is soft, full and concentrated with rounded tannins and a spicy finish.

name: Chateau Saint-Brod iatmectes 2015
description: The nose is expressive and complex with notes of fresh fruit, especially cherries. In the mouth, the attack is full and soft, supported by the roundness and freshness of the tannins. This richness makes the wine fresh and easy to drink. The finish is long and harmonious, with flavors of red fruit and spices.

name: Newerrelt de Brunep Jose Fume (half-bottle) 2005
description: The 2005 Vintage is an elegant and inviting wine. It is light and fresh with a wonderful fruit-forward nose and a clean, well-balanced finish. The wine shows flavors of white peach, grapefruit and citrus, complemented by some sweet oak. The wine is pleasant on the palate and has a long, clean finish. The texture is soft and the wine shows excellent complexity. This is a very refreshing and easy-to-drink wine.

name: Coloma Valitanionegres Red Bellima Wines Greg (375ML halff-bottle) 2001
description: The Greg Norman winery is located in the village of Valavanon. The wine has a dark purple color, with a richly aromatic nose of red berries and spice. On the palate, the wine is supple and ripe, with a long finish. The wine has a complex blend of six indigenous Spanish grapes, whose origins are beyond suggestion. The blend includes Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Syrah.

name: Badolia CarneHa Ondiwi Cabernet Sauvignon 2011
description: The 2011 vintage has produced an impressive and savory wine that has a deep purple color. The nose has red fruit aromas, a hint of spice, and a touch of mint. The palate is soft and elegant with good fruit concentration. The tannins are soft and well balanced with a hint of minerality. The wine has good structure and good length with fresh fruit flavors on the finish.

name: Foncug Numbino rina 1998
description: Fresh, fruity, charming and easy-to-drink; a perfect partner to well-seasoned pasta and rice dishes.  Also excellent with fresh strawberries or mulberries. Purple-colored, with loads of raspberry and berry fruit. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long, heady finish. A great wine to drink with everyday meals.

name: Miravelle MiqSuhpianon Famrelo 2015
description: Blend: 69% Cabernet Sauvignon, 26% Syrah, 6% Petit Verdot Purple-black. Very pure, intense aromas of blueberry, black cherry and blackcurrant, with a touch of camphor and mint and sweet tobacco. Soft, sweet flavors of dark berries, with a touch of crushed black pepper and graphite. Full-bodied, with a velvety texture and a long, ripe finish. Pairs well with roast beef, duck, lamb and cheese. A great value.

name: Alberps Marico Vineyards Teda Pinot Noir 2007
origin: from Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon
description: The nose on the 2007 Cruza Pinot Noir offers black cherry, brambleberry, raspberry and cedar. This wine is very deep and full-bodied on the palate, with a rich and dense core of black fruit, with a hint of licorice, smoke and smoke. The wine's solid tannin backbone promises excellent cellaring potential, but if you drink it now you could enjoy a chocolate dessert!

name: Robfown Greilba Coast Chardonnay 2014
description: Pale yellow color. Bright, with notes of honeydew and apple blossom, with a hint of butterscotch. , winemaker Robby Robby Robby balances power with finesse here in the winery. The winery pressed the grapes and transferred them to French oak barrels. The wine is full bodied, rich and creamy with a soft and round mouthfeel and a long finish. The oak and fruit balance is spot on perfect.

name: Sevbang Thuria Grafina Chardonnay 2005
description: The 2005 Chardonnay is a light golden-colored wine with a light, golden-coloured rim. The nose is full of ripe stone fruit and hints of butterscotch. The palate is soft, with a hint of sweetness, while the finish is long and dry with a balanced acidity.

name: Con Masalo Vitagerialltas Russiatt Selection Medos Red 2007
description: Deep red color with violet hints. A nose of ripe fruits and berries. The palate is rich and balanced, with juicy fruit and a long finish.  Wine Spectator Top 100 of 2011

name: Baronta Do a Tordi Vinesidina Valloge De Canay 2003
description: The grapes are hand harvested, destemmed and fermented in stainless steel tanks. The wine is then aged for 12 months in French oak barrels. The result is a bright ruby-red wine with rich, ripe, berry fruit and a full, round palate. Very elegant and harmonious, with a long, complex finish.

name: TFica Grang Rig + Fa'm Blancs Syrah 2014
description: The full-bodied palate of this wine is packed with blueberry, blackberry and white pepper flavors with a touch of creamy oak on the finish., fruit-laden, unpretentious wine that stays in the bottle longer than the Rhone or even to drink well now. The fruit is from three vineyards in the northern Rhone district of Côtes du Rhône valley.

name: Martetastan Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
origin: from Spring Mountain District, Napa Valley, California
description: The 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon has a deep garnet color. The nose is inviting with notes of black cherry, cassis, and licorice with a hint of graphite. The palate is soft and approachable with flavors of cherry, currants, and a hint of herbs.

name: Tuntallo Pinot Noir 2008
description: The Tuntallo estate has been owned by the Etchart family since 1896 in the region of Barcelona, where it has built its legacy of winemaking since 1920. This past experience is the foundation for the modern, integrated expression of this exceptional region. Made from the indigenous variety of the Ebro River (Tempranillo), this wine has a dark, cherry color and a nose of fresh strawberries and plums with undertones of sweet spices. On the palate, it is fresh and fruity with balanced acidity and a long finish.

name: Herlark Woderia Collomi Pinot Noir 2013
origin: from Russian River, Sonoma County, California
description: The Wodi AVA of northern Sonoma County provides the ideal conditions for Pinot Noir. This wine exhibits cherry and cranberry aromas, accented by notes of spice, cedar, and dried herbs. Rich and smooth on the palate, with a supple tannin backbone, this Pinot Noir has a long, smooth finish.

name: Trost Vineyards Cabernet Wellos 18 Denan Marnot 2011
description: The 2011 vintage is the result of a nearly perfect growing season. We had another great year in the Napa Valley, and this wine is the result of an amazing year. The vintage is showing extremely well and has the classic high quality that many of our vineyard blocks in the vineyard have come to be dominated by. The 2011 vintage is showing beautifully with a rich and bold expression of black cherry and vanilla. In the nose, the wine has aromas of dark fruit, cassis and black pepper with subtle hints of toasty oak. The wine has a very soft and supple entry with loads of bright fruit that continues on the palate. The tannins are firm, the finish smooth and the wine has a great balance and complexity.

name: Ceau Mal Duberaive (half-bottle) 1996
description: and mild temperatures are optimum for growing grapes, which will continue to develop on the vine until the end of harvest. After a light winter, temperatures cooler than usual temperatures in the beginning of April and a little rain. Flowering took place in the beginning of February and the end of March, depending on the vintage. A warm Spring is followed by a long lasting burst of rain and a fine flowering period, which brought the grapes to a good degree of maturity.

name: Maragio Bigolo Bru Saleta Conuma Pieila Lamfantinia 2004
description: Bigolo's 2004 exhibits a deep ruby/purple color, sweet, jammy aromas, and a ripe, sweet, fruity flavor profile. It is a blend of 50% Sangiovese, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot, and 10% Syrah. Opaque and voluptuous, with an opulent, rich, opulent, and sexy style, it is a total hedonist's delight from the first sniff through to the last sip. This hedonist's delight is brought to life by a lush, fruity, and fleshy wine that should drink well for 10-12 years.

name: Clorama Cabernet Sauvignon Chardin-Zapily Chardonnay 2016
description: The 2016 Chard is a blend of 60% California Chardonnay, 20% of other world-class grapes, 10% Riesling, 10% Gewurztraminer, 10% Other Varietals including Chenin Blanc, Riesling and Pinot Grigio. The wine is a brilliant pale gold in the glass. Aromas of ripe peach, golden delicious apples and honeysuckle with a touch of lemon zest. Crisp acidity and a smooth finish. The 2016 Chard has beautiful aromas and flavors of apple, apricot, and citrus.

name: Bodestadbong Kinsing Wines Patos Reserva Zinfandel 2017
description: The Wines of Patagonia are characterized by a high standard of quality and great quality, with an intense, rich color, berry fruit and spicy flavours, rich texture and great structure, all of which are imparted by the unique cepage of the soil that produces these wines.

name: Tyronelus 4 Rieblo-Rayja te Cas 2016
description: , intense and complex, with intense fruit, lots of character, with plenty of spice and hints of leather and forest floor. Full bodied, concentrated wine with lots of character. Deep, dark color. Intense and complex on the nose, with intense fruit and herbal notes. It has a full and very long finish.

name: Domank Espate Merlot 2001
description: A ripe, generous Merlot, with aromas of black cherry, cassis and plum. The palate is layered with plum, spice and black cherry fruit, and a smooth, round finish. The fruit was sourced from the Santa Lucia Highlands in the Russian River Valley, where temperatures moderated by morning fog from the Pacific Ocean. The resulting wine is ripe, with intense color and deep flavors of black cherry and spice.

name: Sme Signatty Homulle's One Daldues Shiraz 2004
description: A wine with structure, balance and complexity. A deep plum/ruby/purple color is followed by a nose of blueberries, cherries, and spice. The palate is medium-full with loads of sweet fruit and some background oak character. This is a wine that should benefit from 2-3 years of bottle age and should last for the long run as well as be a pleasure to drink now and over the next 3-4 years. - Wine Advocate

name: Vally Ruszian Sauvignon (1.5 Liter  agven) 2007
description: The color of the wine is a light yellow with greenish highlights. The bouquet is a complex and intense blend of fresh fruit and floral notes. The taste is dry, full-bodied, with a pleasant, and slightly mineral finish.

name: Domaine de la Priberine Les Clos des Chamiano-Brunelrine Terriea 2015
description: The wine has a deep garnet color. On the nose, the wine is marked by aromas of wild black fruits (blackberries, blackcurrants) and spices. In the mouth, it is round, harmonious and full, with a long finish.

name: Chateau Carger Ane Ovit 2016
origin: from Cotes de Castillon, Bordeaux, France
description: The Côtérus shows the balance of the vintage, the fruit and the French oak integration beautifully. The 2016 vintage shows a deep color, with intense and complex fruit with a sweet attack. It has a soft and full body with an attractive tannic structure. The aromas are reminiscent of red fruit, plums, raspberries and blackberries. There are also balsamic and spicy notes. The tannins are very well-integrated and the wine is with a long finish. The tannins are very elegant, the acidity is present, the fruit concentrated and the wood is nicely integrated. The wine has a lovely balance and a beautiful structure.

name: Jagbhsk Brifenet Sauvignon Blanc 2013
description: The nose is filled with aromas of melon and citrus with a hint of tropical fruit. The palate is full and round with tropical fruit flavors, and a hint of fresh herbs. The finish is long and clean. Pair with seafood, white meats and fresh garden herbs.

name: Calera Hantons Chardonnay (Flaflu-Hault Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
origin: from Mt. Harlan, Central Coast, California
description: The 2014 Hantons Vineyard Chardonnay is a rich, crisp Chardonnay with tropical fruit aromas of pineapple, pineapple and jasmine. On the palate, the wine shows a rich texture and rich flavors of fresh peach, guava, and apricot. This wine is a blend of fruit from the two estate vineyards (Paso Creek & Pisa) that are at the forefront of the Calera blend. The winemaker blended the two together to create a wine that is more fruit forward and easy to drink. Enjoy this Chardonnay with anything from roast chicken to seafood to spicy Asian cuisine.

name: Notter Trinonga Gata Rhenanelena Rooja Old Dange 2000
description: A terrific fruit/tobacco nose! This is a full bodied wine with a full silky, yet balanced palate. The nose is intense, full of stone fruits like peach and nectarine, and floral tones like jasmine. In the mouth it is big and rich with a silky texture and a long finish. Notter Trinico's La Planta wine has a great balance and a great nose.

name: Euzelli Napa Mar Bono Xuzia Well Meleca 2003
description: and vinification is traditional, long maceration followed by one year of aging in new French oak barrels. This results in a rich, full bodied wine with intense berry fruit.  We recommend decanting the wine prior to serving it to show the full character of the wine.  This wine shows intense berry fruit with a good balance between fruit and oak, firm tannins and a long, smooth finish.  We recommend cellaring this wine for up to ten years.  This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot.

name: Behh Cabelt Righ Vineyard Sumierv Auxer Vertapite 2016
description: , the Beh winery strives to achieve a balance between fruit and earth, making a wine that is rich and full-bodied with intense fruit and herbal characteristics, while maintaining the elegance and style that has always defined the Beh winery. Each year the winery strives to achieve a balance between fruit and earth, and the Petit Verdot contributes an extra dimension of violet and lavender, and the Cabernet Franc enhances the flavor and structure. The wine is a deep garnet with aromas of cherries, black pepper and a hint of spice. The palate shows intense cherry and berry flavors, with hints of chocolate and vanilla. The wine has a soft tannin structure, with a smooth finish.

name: Sh. ormul Gravier Riesling ( 007
description: The grapes are harvested by hand at optimal ripeness, then destalked, crushed, fermented in stainless steel tanks, with an average of seven days' worth of skin contact. The wine is then aged in stainless steel tanks to preserve the crisp, fresh fruit flavors. The result is a juicy, off-dry Riesling with just a touch more residual sugar.

name: Monnani Barolo Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 1999
description: A bold, full-bodied, well-structured Cabernet that will continue to improve in the bottle.  This wine is rich and complex, with layers of berry, cherry, cassis, and chocolate flavors, and a solid, smooth finish.

name: R.L. Phegaghe SeCLes Argete Baronar Malbec (Saiterrit-Gobagle) 2012
description: The Phegag Seclos Seclos is a deep purple color. On the nose, aromas of fresh cherries, plums, violets and truffles with an interesting hint of mocha. It has great structure, great tannins and a long finish. The Phegag Seclos Seclos is a great example of the great potential of this wine area.

name: Done Clozier Rose Rouge Blend (OU Kozher) 1996
description: This wine has a beautiful and lovely salmon color. The nose is spicy with lots of red fruit. Very expressive and balanced in the mouth. Very fruity and intense. Nice and fresh finish. This wine is a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Grenache grapes.

name: Dabossion Laton Bravpy Chiantas Cotally Pinot Blanc 2007
description: The grapes are hand harvested and sorted at the winery. Fermentation takes place in stainless steel tanks at controlled temperatures and maceration is on skins. After malolactic fermentation the wine is aged in French oak barrels for 6 months.

name: Le Campano Eitane Coltllaido Ramry 2013
description: Ruby red with purple reflections. The nose is fruity with notes of blackberries, cherries, blackcurrants and spices. The mouth is soft and pleasant, with a good structure, and excellent balance between acidity and alcohol, with a spicy finish.

name: Yarurg Fartetti Cabernet Sauvignon 2007
description: This is the perfect example of the Yarra Valley Cabernet Sauvignon. The grapes for this wine come from the steep hillside terraces of the winery. A viticultural area with well-drained alluvial soils, this area of the Yarra Valley Cabernet Sauvignon shows the true potential of the Languedoc.

name: Strick Wines Cabernet Sauvignon 1998
description: An elegant, full-bodied wine with subtle earthy tones. The aromas are of black cherry, cedar and a hint of mint. In the mouth, the wine is rich and elegant with a touch of black pepper. Firm tannins provide for a smooth, lingering finish.

name: Wankenzry Hill Dicspionlachofn Pinot Gris 2010
description: Bright straw color. On the nose, intense aromas of fresh pears, pears and white peaches. The palate is full, rich and well balanced with luscious stone fruit flavors, great length and a minerally acidity that refreshes the palate.

name: Tenwarda France Chardonnay 2006
origin: from Languedoc, South of France, France
description: The 2006 vintage was a perfect, warm and dry year.  Our vineyard was selected during the growing season, allowing to develop the richness and ripeness of fruit with an opulent nose.  The wines are rich and silky on the palate.  Our Chardonnay grapes were harvested at full maturity, with good varietal character.  The result is a wine of great finesse, complexity and superb balance.

name: Francino Oanchbays Cabernet Sauvignon (OK Koshiglote 2018
description: Intense dark violet-red color. Concentrated nose of red fruit, with hints of chocolate and a herbal touch. Well-structured palate, with ripe tannins and good balance. Long and persistent finish.

name: Granchel & Guyreest Pinot Noir 2001
description: This wine has a beautiful, deep red color.  Intense aromas of dark cherry, blackberry, and raspberry fruit are highlighted by a subtle hint of toasty oak spice.  Flavors of bright, spicy black cherry, toasted oak, and cedar are nicely framed by soft tannins and a balanced acidity.  This is a well-balanced wine with a long, satisfying finish that is reminiscent of the aromas from the nose.  This wine will continue to improve in the bottle and should drink well upon release.

name: Selbanz No Valley Pinot Noir 2017
description: A blend of grapes from two of the most renowned Pinot Noir vineyards in the world, the Selbanz family vineyard in the Russian River Valley is the backbone of Sel Banz. It is the wine that gives the wine its name.

name: Tabeld Hussz Piner Chuvioge 2009
origin: from Chiles Valley, Central Coast, California
description: This is the wine to drink at home as an aperitif.  Pair this wine with oysters on the half shell, sole meuniere or a flavorful seafood dish.

name: Anala Macuria Diif Sto Malby Chardonnay 2007
description: The nose of this wine offers hints of tropical fruits and ripe pears. On the palate, it is rich and smooth, with a hint of minerality. The finish is long and harmonious, with a mineral flavor that comes from the soil.

name: Trrundo Mato Sauvignon Bianco Risa 2007
description: Intense, bright, and pale yellow. The nose is very complex, with hints of citric fruits, pineapple, and grapefruit. The mouth is intense, with great structure and length, with fresh acidity and minerality. It is a long, balanced, intense, and mineral wine.

name: Mark Rookfe Estate Chardonnay 2001
description: This wine has a light golden colour with a nose of melon and tropical fruit.  The palate has rich fruit with a distinctively creamy texture.  The wine has excellent structure, well balanced acidity and a long finish.

name: Anmicewans Estate Righeres 2018
origin: from Paso Robles, Central Coast, California
description: Blend: 52% Grenache, 20% Mourvedre, 9% Syrah, 5% Counoise, 4% Counoise The wine is a rich purple color with a nose of ripe berry, spice and earthy tones. On the palate the wine is medium bodied with a velvety mouth feel and supple tannins which are nicely balanced with the fruit to give the wine a smooth, easy drinking style. The fruit is sourced from the cooler southern end of the Paso Robles region. The wine was barrel aged for 10 months in French oak before blending and bottling.

name: Oulessien Tem. Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
description: The 2013 vintage of Oulessien Tem. Cabernet Sauvignon is a blend of our three estate vineyards in the Napa Valley. The wine is a blend of fruit from our estate vineyards and small amounts of grapes from other Napa Valley vineyards. A medium-weight wine, it is elegant, with blackberry, black cherry, and sweet tobacco flavors. Hints of pepper, vanilla, and cedar add depth and structure to the wine.
